Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

If you‚Äôve been waiting for a sign to level up and get on board something special, this might just be it. We‚Äôre adding a few key players to the team. A core foundation of our end goal, so we‚Äôre looking for the top 1% ‚Äì someone who knows how to build, not just transact. Maybe you‚Äôre doing well, but realise it is best to move now before the golden handcuffs are put on. Or perhaps you're hashtag#solo and missing the team culture. Sick of the headaches of chasing invoices, and would rather spend more time doing what you do best.Whether you're focused on Software or Data, or can make a strong case to pivot into these markets, we want to hear from you. If you‚Äôve got the mindset and the motivation this is the platform.2Ô∏è‚É£ü¶Ö Software or Data ‚Äì New York or DubaiThe US market is part of our DNA. You'll work directly with Nathan and myself who have combined generated over $6,000,000 in the hashtag#USA market. You‚Äôll need to be based in NY, or willing to start in Dubai (yes, that means unsociable hours) with a plan to relocate to NYC.This market is more competitive than ever ‚Äì if you‚Äôre not ready to hustle, it‚Äôll eat you alive. If you‚Äôve got the drive and know how to add value to internal teams and hiring managers, the rewards here are immense. Big BD energy required. Big ambition essential. Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility

Post Content:
Beyond the Waves: Can We First Connect the Sand?A few days ago, I shared my thoughts on the iconic Dubai Metro launch and the still-unrealized dream of inter-emirate metro links. Now, headlines are lighting up with talk of a Dubai‚ÄìMumbai underwater train. Two thousand kilometers. Under the Arabian Sea. Ambitious? Undoubtedly. Exciting? Definitely.But here‚Äôs a question we should ask before diving that deep‚Äîcan we first lay tracks across our own land?Thousands still commute daily between Dubai, Sharjah, Ajman, Abu Dhabi. Anyone who's sat through that morning gridlock knows this isn‚Äôt just a transportation issue‚Äîit‚Äôs a productivity issue, a sustainability issue, a quality of life issue.I‚Äôm not one to dismiss big dreams. After all, this is the UAE‚Äîa country where the word ‚Äúimpossible‚Äù often gets quietly deleted from the dictionary. But even the most revolutionary ideas must respect the first principles of physics, engineering, and economics.So maybe it‚Äôs time we channel some of that futuristic energy into something a little closer to home. High-speed, high-capacity metro links between our emirates. Efficient, eco-friendly, and entirely achievable with today‚Äôs tech.

Who is the Ultimate Beneficial Owner (UBO)?According to the Saudi Ministry of Commerce, a UBO is any individual who owns a stake in a company or exercises effective control over it ‚Äî directly or indirectly.Why is UBO disclosure important? ‚úÖ Enhances transparency in business transactions ‚úÖ Builds an accurate and reliable commercial registry ‚úÖ Ensures compliance with international standardsüìå Key UBO Information to Be Registered:Full name and ID/passport infoDate of birth, nationality, gender, contact detailsResidential or national addressRelationship with the company and reason/date of update If Ahmed owns 90% of the company and El Fayed owns 10%: ‚úî Ahmed= UBO ‚úñ Elfayed = Not a UBO (ownership <25%)A company with:‚úî Ahmed(natural person) ‚Äì Company Manager ‚ÜíUBO‚úñ 20 shareholders, all owning less than 25% ‚ÜíNot a UBOüë§ Who qualifies as a UBO? Anyone who:Owns ‚â•25% of the capitalControls ‚â•25% of voting rightsAppoints/removes the majority of board membersHas influence over company decisionshashtag#UBO hashtag#Transparency hashtag#SaudiVision2030 hashtag#BusinessCompliance hashtag#Disclosure_Is_Your_Responsibility
